rules: Rule1: Either John participates in the show or the drug is safe.
Rule2: If the doctor reports safety, then under the condition that the ethics committee does not approve the drug or whenever the FDA approves the drug, the drug is safe, the trial is halted.
Rule3: Provided that the nurse reports safety, then if the ethics committee does not approve the drug or the FDA's approval implies the drug is safe, the trial is halted.
Rule4: Either the monitor reviews data or the auditor reviews data.
Rule5: If the auditor reviews data, then the nurse reports safety.
Rule6: On the condition that the monitor escalates concern, then if the monitor reviews data, the doctor reports safety.
Rule7: The monitor escalates concern or the auditor escalates concern.
Rule8: Given that the auditor escalates concern, then if the monitor reviews data, the doctor reports safety.
Rule9: John experiences a side effect or the drug is safe.
Rule10: If the doctor documents an adverse event, then it is not the case that John experiences a side effect.
Rule11: The doctor documents an adverse event or the nurse documents an adverse event.
Rule12: If the doctor administers the drug, then John has the skill.
Rule13: The doctor administers the drug or the nurse administers the drug.
Rule14: If the monitor submits a report, then whenever the drug is not safe, it shows efficacy.
Rule15: On the condition that the auditor submits a report, then if the drug is not safe, it shows efficacy.
Rule16: Provided that the monitor completes analysis, the monitor submits a report.
Rule17: Either the monitor completes analysis or the auditor completes analysis.
Rule18: If the nurse administers the drug, then John does not participate in the show.
Rule19: If the committee conducts the final review, then if the auditor completes analysis, the auditor submits a report.
Rule20: Under the condition that the doctor performs the investigator assessment, John requires hospitalization.
Rule21: The doctor performs the investigator assessment or the nurse performs the investigator assessment.
Rule22: If the nurse performs the investigator assessment, then John does not experience a side effect.
Rule23: If John has a serious event, then he does not experience a side effect.
Rule24: If John requires hospitalization, then he has a serious event.
Rule25: If the doctor violates the protocol, then it is not the case that the doctor follows the protocol.
Rule26: Provided that the trial monitors the drug, then if the doctor violates the protocol, the doctor follows the protocol.
Rule27: If it is not the case that if John has the skill, he does not participate in the show, then the doctor violates the protocol.

Rule28: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that the auditor analyzes risk or the monitor analyzes risk or if the nurse documents an adverse event, John does not experience a side effect, then the trial modifies the protocol, then the trial continues.

Rule29: If it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that the auditor analyzes risk or the monitor analyzes risk or if the nurse documents an adverse event, John does not experience a side effect, then the trial modifies the protocol, then the trial does not continue, then the trial terminates.
Rule30: If the drug is not safe, then it does not show efficacy.
facts: Fact1: The committee conducts the final review.
Fact2: The trial monitors the drug.
Fact3: The FDA approves the drug.
Fact4: The trial is not halted.
Fact5: The monitor does not analyze risk.
Fact6: The auditor does not analyze risk.
Fact7: The trial does not modify the protocol.
Fact8: The trial does not terminate.
Fact9: The ethics committee does not approve the drug.
